results.title: Oh Much More Than Bother: This Winnie the Pooh Is Terrifying
results.abstract: When the gentle bear fell into the public domain, a horror director pounced. Glimpses of the low-budget film have enthralled and enraged fans.
des_facet: Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey (Movie)

results.title: What Would the Cast of ‘Knock at the Cabin’ Do?
results.abstract: In an interview, the stars of M. Night Shyamalan’s film address the soul-searching questions posed to their characters.

multimedia.caption: From left, Nikki Amuka-Bird, Abby Quinn, Rupert Grint and Dave Bautista in “Knock at the Cabin.”

results.title: Home-Cooked Spaghetti Dinners and a Glam Photo Shoot: Eight Unusual Oscar Bids
results.abstract: The campaign on behalf of Andrea Riseborough is the latest to provoke controversy, but it’s hardly the most memorable.

results.title: Disney’s Iger Returns to Familiar Stage, but With Different Challenges
results.abstract: The company reports quarterly earnings on Wednesday, and Wall Street is expecting it to lay out a new streaming strategy and operating structure.

results.title: How to Turn a Good Cry Into Good Cinema
results.abstract: Bringing a great crying scene to the big screen requires a combination of craft and empathy. This is how three recent movies — “Close,” “Babylon” and “The Woman King” — pulled it off.

results.title: What Will It Take to Trust M. Night Shyamalan?
results.abstract: The director, whose latest is “Knock at the Cabin,” has been working to regain audience faith, one B-movie at a time.

results.title: ‘Hannah Ha Ha’ Review: Making Ends Meet

results.title: How Much to See a Movie at AMC? It Will Soon Depend Where You Sit.
results.abstract: By the end of 2023, the movie theater chain will offer tickets at three different price tiers, with middle seats costing the most. You’ll pay less if you like the front row.

multimedia.caption: AMC said its new pricing system would not be applied to tickets for discounted Tuesday screenings or showings before 4 p.m.

results.title: Melinda Dillon, 2-Time Oscar Nominee, Is Dead at 83
results.abstract: She was a Broadway star at 23 and then quit acting, but later re-emerged in films like “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” and “A Christmas Story.”
des_facet: Close Encounters of the Third Kind (Movie)

results.title: Reflections on Star Quality From a Golden Age of ‘Junk TV’
results.abstract: In a new memoir, a longtime casting director revels in memories of a bygone Hollywood, matching actors with the roles that made them stars.

results.title: ‘Godland’ Review: Another of God’s Lonely Men Goes Amok (Spiritually)
results.abstract: In this striking drama set in the late 19th century, a Danish priest travels to Iceland and is gradually undone by a world he can’t understand.

multimedia.caption: “Godland” tracks a priest, Lucas (an effective Elliott Crosset Hove), as he trudges across Iceland.
“Godland” tracks a priest, Lucas (an effective Elliott Crosset Hove), as he trudges across Iceland.

results.title: ‘Una Vita Difficile’ Review: Life Comes at You Fast
results.abstract: Alberto Sordi stars as an idealistic Italian Everyman caught up in a changing postwar world in this rediscovered comedy from the ’60s.

results.title: ‘The Blind Man Who Did Not Want to See Titanic’ Review: Just Like the Movies

results.title: ‘Full Time’ Review: No Rest for the Working Girl
results.abstract: A breathlessly tense portrait of modern labor, this French drama stars Laure Calamy as a single mother who hits her breaking point during a nationwide strike.
